result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Peter Lindquist

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Cases 22CF225 and 22CM55 called together. Defendant Gerald Peter Lindquist in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Gerald Peter Lindquist.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: def pleading guilty to 22CM55- obstruct, 22CF225 to be DRI; joint rec for 15 days jail, credit for time served.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CM55 and orders a JOC; 22CF225 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 
$200 DNA only costs.  $25/month payments.  60 days to make first payment.
15 days jail, 15 days jail credit.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

2:02 PM Cases 22CF225 and 22CM55 called together.  Defendant Gerald Peter Lindquist appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Gerald Peter Lindquist.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Atty Harrington notes he's not yet appointed in 22CF225.  Atty Harrington updates def- cases resolved with misdemeanor resolution, requests plea date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CM55 and 22GF273.
